app.title: Pickled Mushroom Marinade Calculator
app.lead: Work out any vinegar brine with food-safe acidity in seconds.
hero.title: Dial in safe acidity for outstanding pickled mushrooms
hero.subtitle: An interactive calculator combining acid math, food safety guidance, and a multilingual workflow for your pantry projects.
highlights.title: Why Pilze_Marinade?
highlights.calc.title: Reliable calculation
highlights.calc.body: Applies the validated formula, rounds to two decimals, and checks the mass balance automatically.
highlights.safety.title: Safety indicator
highlights.safety.body: Color-coded readiness for shelf storage, including pH evaluation and warnings.
highlights.i18n.title: Multilingual interface
highlights.i18n.body: Switch between German, English, and Russian at any time – number formatting adjusts instantly.
highlights.accessibility.title: Accessible experience
highlights.accessibility.body: Clear hints, ARIA live regions, and contrast-optimized visuals keep the workflow inclusive.
process.title: How it works
process.step1.title: Measure your ingredients
process.step1.body: Enter total volume, vinegar strength, and target acidity – dots or commas are both accepted.
process.step2.title: Set your target
process.step2.body: Validation guards against out-of-range values and blocks goals above the vinegar strength.
process.step3.title: Read the verdict
process.step3.body: Traffic light, balance check, and optional pH input highlight how safe the batch is.
safety.title: Safety first
safety.list1: Keep target acidity at or above 2.5% or plan for strict refrigeration.
safety.list2: Clean and sterilise equipment, jars, and lids before filling.
safety.list3: Measure pH regularly and raise the vinegar share if it drifts above 4.6.
safety.cta: Follow trusted canning guidelines and use only flawless produce.
faq.title: FAQ
faq.q1.title: Why do the results round?
faq.q1.body: Two decimals are practical and match what most kitchen scales or measuring cups can deliver.
faq.q2.title: May I swap the vinegar essence?
faq.q2.body: Yes, as long as the vinegar strength sits between 3 and 25%. Enter the exact percentage in the field.
faq.q3.title: Does the app support other units?
faq.q3.body: Calculations run on millilitres. Convert litres or cups to ml before entering the values.
input.total.label: Total volume (ml)
input.vinegar.label: Vinegar strength (%)
input.vinegar.help: Supply the acetic acid percentage of your vinegar (3–25%).
input.target.label: Target acidity (%)
input.ph.label: Measured pH (optional)
input.mode.jar: I already have the final batch in the jar
input.mode.note: Jar mode skips recomputation – use it for documentation only.
errors.invalidNumber: Number format not recognised. Use digits, dot or comma.
errors.range: Value is outside the permitted range.
errors.ratio: Target acidity must not exceed the vinegar strength.
errors.math: Calculation failed – please double-check the inputs.
results.title: Calculated volumes
results.sum.fail: Mass balance failed – verify the values.
results.none: Fill in all required fields to view the results.
status.title: Safety indicator
status.unknown: No status until a target acidity is entered.
info.title: Safety information
info.ph: Guideline: pH ≤ 4.6 to protect against botulism.
info.hygiene: Keep everything clean, sterilise jars and fill while hot.
info.storage: Store in a cool, dark place. Low-acid brines must stay in the fridge.
ph.status.ok: pH value is in the safe range (≤ 4.6).
ph.status.warn: Borderline – aim for a value below 4.6.
ph.status.bad: pH too high – increase vinegar proportion.
recipes.title: 20 Russian Pickled Mushroom Recipes
recipes.subtitle: Trusted classics from Russian culinary references with verified acidity.
recipes.filter.label: Filter recipes
